title: Commonwealth Bank outage causes cardless cash and netbank to crash
text:
Commonwealth Bank customers have been left in a lunchtime lurch after a technical issue caused Cardless Cash, Netbank and the bank's app to go down on Thursday.

The glitch also caused issues at branches, and briefly affected the bank's eftpos machines and ATMs.

An outage map shows the issue is affecting customers nationwide, with many of them furious they were not alerted by the bank before they had tried to make a payment.

Commonwealth Bank customers around Australia have been left in the lurch as the bank's systems crashed just in time for lunch

The bank told customers about 12.15pm it was 'investigating the issue', and just 45 minutes later announced the crash had caused some branches to close entirely.

Customers complained of being unable to eat as they could not access their money, while others had been stuck at checkouts.

The bank said they were urgently working to find a solution, but have been forced to shut branches while they work on it

'Currently sitting at Woolworths with countless other CommBank victims,' one Facebook user reported. 'We all look so impressed.'

One man said he had been left stranded at the petrol station, having already filled up their car.

'I’m stuck at the petrol station with no cash to pay for it and I’ve got work in half an hour!' he wrote.

Another woman took to Twitter to tell the bank she was being held captive by the cafe she'd gone to for lunch as she was unable to pay for her meal.

'Can’t pay for lunch. Been held captive until I can pay my ransom aka the bill,' she wrote.

A spokesperson from the bank responded to disgruntled customers on social media, telling them the bank was 'currently experiencing an issue affecting some of our services'.

'We are urgently investigating this and we’re sorry for any inconvenience caused,' the spokesperson wrote.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted the Commonwealth Bank for comment.
description: Commonwealth Bank customers have been left in a lunchtime lurch after a technical issue caused cardless cash, netbank and the bank's app to go down.
authors: Hannah Moore For Daily Mail Australia
